item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Everybody does have a book in them, but in most cases that's where it should stay." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Many religions now come before us with ingratiating smirks and outspread hands, like an unctuous merchant in a bazaar. They offer consolation and solidarity and uplift, competing as they do in a marketplace. But we have a right to remember how barbarically they behaved when they were strong and were making an offer that people could not refuse." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "[E]xceptional claims demand exceptional evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Why do humans exist? A major part of the answer: because Pikaia Gracilens survived the Burgess decimation." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "If you gave [Jerry] Falwell an enema he could be buried in a matchbox." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Walter add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "<i>Your favorite virtue?</i> An appreciation for irony." -- Christopher Hitchens
